comments.body:
With the current fix, changing the number of threads back to a previously used value does not work:

{code}
#
# euca-modify-property -peuca='com.eucalyptus.system.Threads.execServices.get("Eucalyptus.dns:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.UDPHandler/").numThreads'
PROPERTY	euca	128 was executed successfully.
# 
# 
# euca-modify-property -pdns.udp.num_worker_threads=1
PROPERTY	dns.udp.num_worker_threads	1 was 128
#
# 
# dig compute.localhost @10.111.5.124 

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.30.rc1.el6_6.2 <<>> compute.localhost @10.111.5.124
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 25299
;; flags: qr aa rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;compute.localhost.		IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
compute.localhost.	60	IN	A	10.111.5.124

;; Query time: 62 msec
;; SERVER: 10.111.5.124#53(10.111.5.124)
;; WHEN: Tue Mar 31 14:28:00 2015
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 51

# 
# 
# euca-modify-property -peuca='com.eucalyptus.system.Threads.execServices.get("Eucalyptus.dns:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.UDPHandler/").numThreads'
PROPERTY	euca	1 was executed successfully.
# 
# 
# euca-modify-property -pdns.udp.num_worker_threads=128
PROPERTY	dns.udp.num_worker_threads	128 was 1
# 
# 
# dig compute.localhost @10.111.5.124 

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.30.rc1.el6_6.2 <<>> compute.localhost @10.111.5.124
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 58586
;; flags: qr aa rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;compute.localhost.		IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
compute.localhost.	60	IN	A	10.111.5.124

;; Query time: 59 msec
;; SERVER: 10.111.5.124#53(10.111.5.124)
;; WHEN: Tue Mar 31 14:28:22 2015
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 51

# 
# 
# euca-modify-property -peuca='com.eucalyptus.system.Threads.execServices.get("Eucalyptus.dns:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.UDPHandler/").numThreads'
PROPERTY	euca	1 was executed successfully.
# 
# 
{code}

[~spark], although that should be fine for the UDP worker, I do not think it is generally a safe approach in cases where items could be queued concurrently. We should also verify that when we change pool sizes that the number of threads in the system changes accordingly (i.e. the previously used threads should stop)
I retract my previous comment on adding/starting workers. I'm not quite sure what we're trying to do there so no reason to change that part.

[~sjones] http://pastebin.com/Yfz67i37

Can you please review this one?

[~spark], I think on line 9 you are missing "return". The method is not thread safe, but I think it would fail in reasonable ways.

Ideally, we would simply adjust the size of the existing thread pool by setting the core/max size. This is not possible currently due to the odd use of an intermediate queue/runnable rather than using the pools queue directly.
[~sjones] Another option is not to fix this issue now if we're concerned about thread safety. It's not a critical bug. Thought?

[~spark], I did a quick review of where thread pool size changes occur currently and there are two other places which relate to these properties:

* cloud.vmstate.max_state_threads
* <partition>.storage.maxconcurrentsnapshotuploads

so should be infrequent. I'd say put the fix you have now in 4.1.1 and we can revisit later if we need to alter the behaviour for new usages.

We should also verify that the thread count changes as expected when the related properties are changed.
To test, see sjone's first comment.

This is now working per test described in the first comment:
{code}
[g-26-08:/opt]euca-modify-property -peuca='com.eucalyptus.system.Threads.execServices.get("Eucalyptus.dns:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.UDPHandler/").numThreads'
PROPERTY	euca	128 was executed successfully.
[g-26-08:/opt]euca-modify-property -pdns.udp.num_worker_threads=1
PROPERTY	dns.udp.num_worker_threads	1 was 128
[g-26-08:/opt]dig compute.localhost @10.111.5.128 +noall +answer

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.30.rc1.el6_6.2 <<>> compute.localhost @10.111.5.128 +noall +answer
;; global options: +cmd
compute.localhost.	60	IN	A	10.111.5.128
[g-26-08:/opt]euca-modify-property -peuca='com.eucalyptus.system.Threads.execServices.get("Eucalyptus.dns:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.UDPHandler/").numThreads'
PROPERTY	euca	1 was executed successfully.
[g-26-08:/opt]euca-modify-property -pdns.udp.num_worker_threads=128
PROPERTY	dns.udp.num_worker_threads	128 was 1
[g-26-08:/opt]dig compute.localhost @10.111.5.128 +noall +answer

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.30.rc1.el6_6.2 <<>> compute.localhost @10.111.5.128 +noall +answer
;; global options: +cmd
compute.localhost.	60	IN	A	10.111.5.128
[g-26-08:/opt]euca-modify-property -peuca='com.eucalyptus.system.Threads.execServices.get("Eucalyptus.dns:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.UDPHandler/").numThreads'
PROPERTY	euca	128 was executed successfully.
[g-26-08:/opt]
{code}

It looks like existing threads are not being cleaned up when a new thread pool is created:

{code}
#
# euca-modify-property -peuca='StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder( ); Thread.getAllStackTraces().keySet().each{ Thread t -> sb.append( t.name ); sb.append("\n"); }; sb' | grep UDPHandler | wc -l
1300
# 
{code}

I've tried forcing GC and waiting for 30 mins or so after changing the pool size.

[~mmunn1], did you observe a reduction in UDPHandler threads when adjusting the pool size?
[~sjones] No I did not check, I saw the pool size change correctly when I preformed the test you described.
